ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about independently taking charge of my own art project and what it means to devote time and energy to work with my art subjects to make our vision into a reality. It was super great having Lisa and Darby's supportas well as the voices of my peersalong the way to bump ideas and get input during crits.

I learned how to sustain ideas and adapt new techniques and perspectives into my concentration. I have never focused on a photography project for so long, and this gave me the chance to. While I acquired much knowledge from my teacher and TA, I also learned a lot from the visiting artists speeches and their works.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: everything about the course, Lisa and Darby, class peers
Weaknesses: very free-flowing, can be pro or con but some of the photo lab days weren't the most helpful

The course was well-designed, and the class dynamic was fantastic. The only thing I would like to see improved would be the syllabus. I would liked to have had access to a document that detailed when everything was due.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Totally!! It was a great class and you won't ever regret taking a course with Lisa. The course really opened up the horizons of taking art (especially photography) courses to me at Yale.

Yes! I would definitely recommend this course to someone who has at least taken one photography course at Yale. It is a chance to broaden your portfolio and focus heavily on a theme that interests you.
